str2: Therefore, then. Apparently a primary word; certainly, or accordingly.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A cohort, the tenth part of a legion; a military guard.

A commander of a thousand men, a military tribune. From chilioi and archo; the commander of a thousand soldiers
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From hupo and a derivative of eresso; an under-oarsman, i.e. subordinate.

Jewish. From Iouda; Judaean, i.e. Belonging to Jehudah.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From sun and lambano; to clasp, i.e. Seize; specially, to conceive; by implication, to aid.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To bind, tie, fasten; I impel, compel; I declare to be prohibited and unlawful. A primary verb; to bind.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
